clean_content:
Definition / general

* Also called Heck disease* Discrete, recurrent papillary lesions on oral mucosa in Native American and Inuit children, associated with HPV 1, 13, 32 ([Eur J Dermatol 2011;21:396](21697033))

Case reports

* 7 year old girl with HPV 32 related disease ([J Maxillofac Oral Surg 2011;10:357](23204755))

Clinical images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavitymultifocalepithelialhyperplasiaclinical1.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3267916/figure/Fig2/)

Slightly elevated

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavitymultifocalepithelialhyperplasiaclinical2.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3267916/figure/Fig1/)

Multiple lesions

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityfocalepithelialhyperplasiajle01.jpg)](https://www.jle.com/en/revues/medecine/ejd/e-docs/00/04/69/F4/texte_alt_jleejd1347gr1.jpg)

Lesions on tongue and lip

Gross description

* Well circumscribed, sessile and pale elevation of buccal mucosa

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Balloon cells in Malpighian layers, localized areas of mucosal epithelial hyperplasia with marked acanthosis and parakeratosis

Microscopic (histologic) images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavitymultifocalepithelialhyperplasiamicro1.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3267916/figure/Fig3/)

Parakeratosis

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavitymultifocalepithelialhyperplasiamicro2.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3267916/figure/Fig4/)

Typical nuclear changes
